I sought the Lord, and he heard me, and delivered me from all my fears.
And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose.
But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.
Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.
Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.
For all the promises of God in him are yea, and in him Amen, unto the glory of God by us.
But they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.
Let your conversation be without covetousness; and be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.
Casting all your care upon him; for he careth for you.
God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
Delight thyself also in the Lord: and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.
Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you.
For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the Lord, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you an expected end.
Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Ghost.

When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee; and through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame kindle upon thee.
My help cometh from the Lord, which made heaven and earth.
But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keep you from evil.
Being confident of this very thing, that he which hath begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ.
Set your affection on things above, not on things on the earth.
Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need.
As for God, his way is perfect: the word of the Lord is tried: he is a buckler to all those that trust in him.
The thief cometh not, but for to steal, and to kill, and to destroy: I am come that they might have life, and that they might have it more abundantly.
The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger: but they that seek the Lord shall not want any good thing.
Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
He shall call upon me, and I will answer him: I will be with him in trouble; I will deliver him, and honour him.
And this is the confidence that we have in him, that, if we ask any thing according to his will, he heareth us:
He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.
He that spared not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how shall he not with him also freely give us all things?
The Lord is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.
So shall my word be that goeth forth out of my mouth: it shall not return unto me void, but it shall accomplish that which I please, and it shall prosper in the thing whereto I sent it.
The name of the Lord is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.
Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.
But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.
The steps of a good man are ordered by the Lord: and he delighteth in his way.
Therefore being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ:
Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering; (for he is faithful that promised;)
Yea, let none that wait on thee be ashamed: let them be ashamed which transgress without cause.
For your shame ye shall have double; and for confusion they shall rejoice in their portion: therefore in their land they shall possess the double: everlasting joy shall be unto them.
Commit thy works unto the Lord, and thy thoughts shall be established.
Bless the Lord, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:
Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us,
I waited patiently for the Lord; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.

And I will bring the blind by a way that they knew not; I will lead them in paths that they have not known: I will make darkness light before them, and crooked things straight. These things will I do unto them, and not forsake them.
For he satisfieth the longing soul, and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.
This is my comfort in my affliction: for thy word hath quickened me.

And they that shall be of thee shall build the old waste places: thou shalt raise up the foundations of many generations; and thou shalt be called, The repairer of the breach, The restorer of paths to dwell in.
The Lord upholdeth all that fall, and raiseth up all those that be bowed down.

And he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.
If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your Father which is in heaven give good things to them that ask him?
The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trusted in him, and I am helped: therefore my heart greatly rejoiceth; and with my song will I praise him.
The Lord thy God in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing.
Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the Lord.
Behold, I have graven thee upon the palms of my hands; thy walls are continually before me.
Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.
It is of the Lord's mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.
Seek the Lord and his strength, seek his face continually.
Blessed be the Lord, who daily loadeth us with benefits, even the God of our salvation. Selah.
There is therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.
Faithful is he that calleth you, who also will do it.
And he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.
And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.
For the Lord God will help me; therefore shall I not be confounded: therefore have I set my face like a flint, and I know that I shall not be ashamed.
For by thee I have run through a troop; and by my God have I leaped over a wall.
The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.
He shall feed his flock like a shepherd: he shall gather the lambs with his arm, and carry them in his bosom, and shall gently lead those that are with young.
Thou wilt shew me the path of life: in thy presence is fullness of joy; at thy right hand there are pleasures for evermore.
As for God, his way is perfect; the word of the Lord is tried: he is a buckler to all them that trust in him.
My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.
Ye that fear the Lord, trust in the Lord: he is their help and their shield.
Finally, my brethren, be strong in the Lord, and in the power of his might.
Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.
I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
Great peace have they which love thy law: and nothing shall offend them.
The Lord shall fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.
Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusteth in thee.
Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the Lord.
Nay, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him that loved us.
And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.
I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go: I will guide thee with mine eye.
Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.
Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.
What time I am afraid, I will trust in thee.
Trust in the Lord with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.
There is no fear in love; but perfect love casteth out fear: because fear hath torment. He that feareth is not made perfect in love.
Let your conversation be without covetousness; and be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.
And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, Lord, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.
If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.

When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee; and through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame kindle upon thee.
Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.
Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Ghost.
For the Lord God is a sun and shield: the Lord will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.
For who is God, save the Lord? and who is a rock, save our God?
But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
The blessing of the Lord, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.
My soul melteth for heaviness: strengthen thou me according unto thy word.
For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the Lord, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you an expected end.
He will not suffer thy foot to be moved: he that keepeth thee will not slumber.
Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.
Shew me thy ways, O Lord; teach me thy paths.
Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me:
Commit thy way unto the Lord; trust also in him; and he shall bring it to pass.
The Lord is nigh unto all them that call upon him, to all that call upon him in truth.
Casting all your care upon him; for he careth for you.
As for God, his way is perfect: the word of the Lord is tried: he is a buckler to all those that trust in him.
Be strong and of a good courage, fear not, nor be afraid of them: for the Lord thy God, he it is that doth go with thee; he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee.
I wait for the Lord, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.
For the mountains shall depart, and the hills be removed; but my kindness shall not depart from thee, neither shall the covenant of my peace be removed, saith the Lord that hath mercy on thee.
The Lord is merciful and gracious, slow to anger, and plenteous in mercy.
God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
There are many devices in a man's heart; nevertheless the counsel of the Lord, that shall stand.
Since thou wast precious in my sight, thou hast been honourable, and I have loved thee: therefore will I give men for thee, and people for thy life.
Call unto me, and I will answer thee, and show thee great and mighty things, which thou knowest not.
Wait on the Lord: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the Lord.
And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose.
I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me.

To appoint unto them that mourn in Zion, to give unto them beauty for ashes, the oil of joy for mourning, the garment of praise for the spirit of heaviness; that they might be called trees of righteousness, the planting of the Lord, that he might be glorified.
Thou art my hiding place and my shield: I hope in thy word.
If ye shall ask any thing in my name, I will do it.
He giveth power to the faint; and to them that have no might he increaseth strength.
The Lord is thy keeper: the Lord is thy shade upon thy right hand.
And whatsoever we ask, we receive of him, because we keep his commandments, and do those things that are pleasing in his sight.
Oh how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee; which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee before the sons of men!
Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you:
The Spirit itself beareth witness with our spirit, that we are the children of God:
When I cry unto thee, then shall mine enemies turn back: this I know; for God is for me.

There hath no temptation taken you but such as is common to man: but God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that ye are able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, that ye may be able to bear it.
The Lord is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.
Who delivered us from so great a death, and doth deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliver us;
The steps of a good man are ordered by the Lord: and he delighteth in his way.

At that time will I bring you again, even in the time that I gather you: for I will make you a name and a praise among all people of the earth, when I turn back your captivity before your eyes, saith the Lord.
Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O Lord, my strength, and my redeemer.
For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.
Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.
Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all thy getting get understanding.
And the Lord shall guide thee continually, and satisfy thy soul in drought, and make fat thy bones: and thou shalt be like a watered garden, and like a spring of water, whose waters fail not.
The sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.
Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?
I am the vine, ye are the branches: He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me ye can do nothing.
For his anger endureth but a moment; in his favour is life: weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.
What shall we then say to these things? If God be for us, who can be against us?
Ye are of God, little children, and have overcome them: because greater is he that is in you, than he that is in the world.
And he shall bring forth thy righteousness as the light, and thy judgment as the noonday.
Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering; (for he is faithful that promised;)
It is God that girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way perfect.
In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
But Jesus beheld them, and said unto them, With men this is impossible; but with God all things are possible.
Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the Lord.
In righteousness shalt thou be established: thou shalt be far from oppression; for thou shalt not fear: and from terror; for it shall not come near thee.
Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger: but they that seek the Lord shall not want any good thing.

And I will bring the blind by a way that they knew not; I will lead them in paths that they have not known: I will make darkness light before them, and crooked things straight. These things will I do unto them, and not forsake them.
Faithful is he that calleth you, who also will do it.
The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trusted in him, and I am helped: therefore my heart greatly rejoiceth; and with my song will I praise him.
He keepeth the paths of judgment, and preserveth the way of his saints.
For the Lord God will help me; therefore shall I not be confounded: therefore have I set my face like a flint, and I know that I shall not be ashamed.
Being confident of this very thing, that he which hath begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ:
Many sorrows shall be to the wicked: but he that trusteth in the Lord, mercy shall compass him about.
Let not your heart be troubled: ye believe in God, believe also in me.
Delight thyself also in the Lord: and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.
Now the God of patience and consolation grant you to be like-minded one toward another according to Christ Jesus:
And if we know that he hear us, whatsoever we ask, we know that we have the petitions that we desired of him.
He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.

But he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.

When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee; and through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame kindle upon thee.
Shew me thy ways, O Lord; teach me thy paths.
And hope maketh not ashamed; because the love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Ghost which is given unto us.
As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our transgressions from us.
Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
The name of the Lord is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.
Let your conversation be without covetousness; and be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.
He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the Lord.
For I the Lord thy God will hold thy right hand, saying unto thee, Fear not; I will help thee.
And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, Lord, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.
For he shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.
For I, saith the Lord, will be unto her a wall of fire round about, and will be the glory in the midst of her.
What time I am afraid, I will trust in thee.
For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the Lord, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you an expected end.
Who are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.
Therefore will not we fear, though the earth be removed, and though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea;
So shall my word be that goeth forth out of my mouth: it shall not return unto me void, but it shall accomplish that which I please, and it shall prosper in the thing whereto I sent it.
And I give unto them eternal life; and they shall never perish, neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand.
As for God, his way is perfect: the word of the Lord is tried: he is a buckler to all those that trust in him.
Nay, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him that loved us.
My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.
Thy word have I hid in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.
Finally, my brethren, be strong in the Lord, and in the power of his might.
Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.
For it is God which worketh in you both to will and to do of his good pleasure.
Behold, the Lord's hand is not shortened, that it cannot save; neither his ear heavy, that it cannot hear:
Commit thy way unto the Lord; trust also in him; and he shall bring it to pass.
But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.
Who satisfieth thy mouth with good things; so that thy youth is renewed like the eagle's.
The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.
And whatsoever we ask, we receive of him, because we keep his commandments, and do those things that are pleasing in his sight.
But I trusted in thee, O Lord: I said, Thou art my God.
And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need.
The Lord is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?
He giveth power to the faint; and to them that have no might he increaseth strength.
The righteous shall inherit the land, and dwell therein for ever.
If ye shall ask any thing in my name, I will do it.
This is my comfort in my affliction: for thy word hath quickened me.
Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us,
I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
But they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.
He will not suffer thy foot to be moved: he that keepeth thee will not slumber.
The blessing of the Lord, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.
As for God, his way is perfect; the word of the Lord is tried: he is a buckler to all them that trust in him.
I have set the Lord always before me: because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.
Have not I commanded thee? Be strong and of a good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the Lord thy God is with thee whithersoever thou goest.
Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.
And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose.
So that we may boldly say, The Lord is my helper, and I will not fear what man shall do unto me.
The righteous cry, and the Lord heareth, and delivereth them out of all their troubles.
But the God of all grace, who hath called us unto his eternal glory by Christ Jesus, after that ye have suffered a while, make you perfect, stablish, strengthen, settle you.
Rest in the Lord, and wait patiently for him: fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.
If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you.
Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusteth in thee.
For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive; and plenteous in mercy unto all them that call upon thee.
Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.
The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? The Lord is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
For the mountains shall depart, and the hills be removed; but my kindness shall not depart from thee, neither shall the covenant of my peace be removed, saith the Lord that hath mercy on thee.
But Jesus beheld them, and said unto them, With men this is impossible; but with God all things are possible.
The Lord will give strength unto his people; the Lord will bless his people with peace.
Since thou wast precious in my sight, thou hast been honourable, and I have loved thee: therefore will I give men for thee, and people for thy life.
The Lord hath appeared of old unto me, saying, Yea, I have loved thee with an everlasting love: therefore with lovingkindness have I drawn thee.
The steps of a good man are ordered by the Lord: and he delighteth in his way.
If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.
In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.
Grant thee according to thine own heart, and fulfil all thy counsel.
Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.
But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keep you from evil.
The Lord is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.
Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering; (for he is faithful that promised;)
He shall cover thee with his feathers, and under his wings shalt thou trust: his truth shall be thy shield and buckler.
And this is the confidence that we have in him, that, if we ask any thing according to his will, he heareth us:
Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.
They are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness.

There hath no temptation taken you but such as is common to man: but God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that ye are able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, that ye may be able to bear it.
In my distress I called upon the Lord, and cried unto my God: he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry came before him, even into his ears.
Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Ghost.
Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the Lord.
But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.
For he satisfieth the longing soul, and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.
The Lord thy God in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing.
He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.
These things I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.
Delight thyself also in the Lord: and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.
I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go: I will guide thee with mine eye.
Seek the Lord and his strength, seek his face continually.
Blessed be the Lord, who daily loadeth us with benefits, even the God of our salvation. Selah.
And the Lord shall guide thee continually, and satisfy thy soul in drought, and make fat thy bones: and thou shalt be like a watered garden, and like a spring of water, whose waters fail not.
For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.
Thou art my hiding place and my shield: I hope in thy word.
My flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.
Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and today, and forever.
The name of the Lord is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.
For his anger endureth but a moment; in his favour is life: weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.
Ho, every one that thirsteth, come ye to the waters, and he that hath no money; come ye, buy, and eat; yea, come, buy wine and milk without money and without price.
God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
The Lord shall fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.
Truly my soul waiteth upon God: from him cometh my salvation.
Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.
He giveth power to the faint; and to them that have no might he increaseth strength.
The young lions do lack, and suffer hunger: but they that seek the Lord shall not want any good thing.
Then he answered and spake unto me, saying, This is the word of the Lord unto Zerubbabel, saying, Not by might, nor by power, but by my spirit, saith the Lord of hosts.
As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our transgressions from us.
If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O Lord, my strength, and my redeemer.
My help cometh from the Lord, which made heaven and earth.
Faithful is he that calleth you, who also will do it.
For the Lord God is a sun and shield: the Lord will give grace and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk uprightly.
The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.
Nay, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him that loved us.
Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.
The thief cometh not, but for to steal, and to kill, and to destroy: I am come that they might have life, and that they might have it more abundantly.
There are many devices in a man's heart; nevertheless the counsel of the Lord, that shall stand.
The Lord is nigh unto all them that call upon him, to all that call upon him in truth.
The Lord is nigh unto all them that call upon him, to all that call upon him in truth.
Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusteth in thee.
What time I am afraid, I will trust in thee.
As for God, his way is perfect; the word of the Lord is tried: he is a buckler to all them that trust in him.
And the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.
As for God, his way is perfect: the word of the Lord is tried: he is a buckler to all those that trust in him.

When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee; and through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame kindle upon thee.
The Lord is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?
For I the Lord thy God will hold thy right hand, saying unto thee, Fear not; I will help thee.
Who redeemeth thy life from destruction; who crowneth thee with lovingkindness and tender mercies;
Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you:
Let us therefore come boldly unto the throne of grace, that we may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need.
He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: his heart is fixed, trusting in the Lord.
For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the Lord, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you an expected end.
Casting all your care upon him; for he careth for you.
Wait on the Lord: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the Lord.
Then shalt thou call, and the Lord shall answer; thou shalt cry, and he shall say, Here I am. If thou take away from the midst of thee the yoke, the putting forth of the finger, and speaking vanity;
And we know that all things work together for good to them that love God, to them who are the called according to his purpose.
I waited patiently for the Lord; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.
Have not I commanded thee? Be strong and of a good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the Lord thy God is with thee whithersoever thou goest.
Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall sustain thee: he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved.
For all the promises of God in him are yea, and in him Amen, unto the glory of God by us.
If ye shall ask any thing in my name, I will do it.
I have set the Lord always before me: because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.

And David said to Solomon his son, Be strong and of good courage, and do it: fear not, nor be dismayed: for the Lord God, even my God, will be with thee; he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee, until thou hast finished all the work for the service of the house of the Lord.
And call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.
Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him: I will set him on high, because he hath known my name.
Commit thy works unto the Lord, and thy thoughts shall be established.
This is my comfort in my affliction: for thy word hath quickened me.
Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the Lord.
But they that wait upon the Lord shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles; they shall run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.
Wherein ye greatly rejoice, though now for a season, if need be, ye are in heaviness through manifold temptations:
Commit thy way unto the Lord; trust also in him; and he shall bring it to pass.
That no man should be moved by these afflictions: for yourselves know that we are appointed thereunto.
Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Ghost.
Shew me thy ways, O Lord; teach me thy paths.
Trust in the Lord with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.
Let, I pray thee, thy merciful kindness be for my comfort, according to thy word unto thy servant.
The Lord shall preserve thee from all evil: he shall preserve thy soul.
Bless the Lord, O my soul, and forget not all his benefits:
These things I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.
For the mountains shall depart, and the hills be removed; but my kindness shall not depart from thee, neither shall the covenant of my peace be removed, saith the Lord that hath mercy on thee.
Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us,
He brought me up also out of a horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock, and established my goings.
For in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me upon a rock.
Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering; (for he is faithful that promised;)
And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, Lord, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.
This is my comfort in my affliction: for thy word hath quickened me.
And hope maketh not ashamed; because the love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the Holy Ghost which is given unto us.
He that dwelleth in the secret place of the most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
I will sing of the mercies of the Lord forever: with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.
My soul fainteth for thy salvation: but I hope in thy word.
The steps of a good man are ordered by the Lord: and he delighteth in his way.
Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
What shall we then say to these things? If God be for us, who can be against us?
I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
Thou wilt shew me the path of life: in thy presence is fullness of joy; at thy right hand there are pleasures for evermore.
Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold thee with the right hand of my righteousness.
O Lord of hosts, blessed is the man that trusteth in thee.
But the Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keep you from evil.
For the Lord is good; his mercy is everlasting; and his truth endureth to all generations.

No weapon that is formed against thee shall prosper; and every tongue that shall rise against thee in judgment thou shalt condemn. This is the heritage of the servants of the Lord, and their righteousness is of me, saith the Lord.
Rest in the Lord, and wait patiently for him: fret not thyself because of him who prospereth in his way, because of the man who bringeth wicked devices to pass.

But he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather glory in my infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me.
There is therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit.
Let your conversation be without covetousness; and be content with such things as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.
Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.
The Lord is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.
Blessed be God, which hath not turned away my prayer, nor his mercy from me.
Fear not: for I am with thee: I will bring thy seed from the east, and gather thee from the west;
My flesh and my heart faileth: but God is the strength of my heart, and my portion forever.
Both riches and honour come of thee, and thou reignest over all; and in thine hand is power and might; and in thine hand it is to make great, and to give strength unto all.
The name of the Lord is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.
Finally, my brethren, be strong in the Lord, and in the power of his might.
Who delivered us from so great a death, and doth deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliver us;
For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive; and plenteous in mercy unto all them that call upon thee.
And the work of righteousness shall be peace; and the effect of righteousness quietness and assurance forever.
If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, that giveth to all men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.
Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.
Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?
For the Lord giveth wisdom: out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding.
Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness: he is gracious, and full of compassion, and righteous.
Call unto me, and I will answer thee, and show thee great and mighty things, which thou knowest not.
And this is the confidence that we have in him, that, if we ask any thing according to his will, he heareth us:
Delight thyself also in the Lord: and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.
For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.
And all thy children shall be taught of the Lord; and great shall be the peace of thy children.
Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt go: I will guide thee with mine eye.
Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O Lord, my strength, and my redeemer.
There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the Lord.
The Lord is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart; and saveth such as be of a contrite spirit.
It is God that girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way perfect.

Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of witnesses, let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which doth so easily beset us, and let us run with patience the race that is set before us,
The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the Lord is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
He giveth power to the faint; and to them that have no might he increaseth strength.
And I give unto them eternal life; and they shall never perish, neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand.
He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.
Thou whom I have taken from the ends of the earth, and called thee from the chief men thereof, and said unto thee, Thou art my servant; I have chosen thee, and not cast thee away.
A little that a righteous man hath is better than the riches of many wicked.
Since thou wast precious in my sight, thou hast been honourable, and I have loved thee: therefore will I give men for thee, and people for thy life.
He shall cry unto me, Thou art my Father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.
For a just man falleth seven times, and riseth up again: but the wicked shall fall into mischief.
And being fully persuaded that, what he had promised, he was able also to perform.
Mine eyes fail for thy word, saying, When wilt thou comfort me?
But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
The Lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trusted in him, and I am helped: therefore my heart greatly rejoiceth; and with my song will I praise him.
For thou art my hope, O Lord God: thou art my trust from my youth.
So that we may boldly say, The Lord is my helper, and I will not fear what man shall do unto me.
For thus saith the Lord God, the Holy One of Israel; In returning and rest shall ye be saved; in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength: and ye would not.
Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the Lord.
The way of the Lord is strength to the upright: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.
If ye then, being evil, know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall your Father which is in heaven give good things to them that ask him?
The Lord is the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup: thou maintainest my lot.
As for God, his way is perfect; the word of the Lord is tried: he is a buckler to all them that trust in him.
My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.
If the Son therefore shall make you free, ye shall be free indeed.
I wait for the Lord, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.
